description.plain:
Originally a 5-person group, G.R.L. will be making their return as a trio. Lauren Bennett and Natasha Slayton are the only original members and will be joined by Jazzy Mejia.

G.R.L. is a girl group that was formed by Robin Antin, best known for bringing together The Pussycat Dolls, but also created the Paradiso Girls, which Bennett was a member of as well.

Beginning in 2013, along with Bennett and Slayton, the original crew included Simone Battle, Emmalyn Estrada, and Paula van Oppen. Their first single “Vacation” was released alongside Britney Spears‘ “Ooh La La” to be included on the soundtrack for The Smurfs 2. Moving onto 2014, after achieving success with their feature on Pitbull’s “Wild Wild Love” in February, the group released their self-titled EP in July, spawning the successful single “Ugly Heart.”

In September 2014, Simone Battle was found dead in her home and the group took some time off. The following January in 2015, they released “Lighthouse,” a dedication to Battle. In June, it was announced that the group was disbanding. A year later, it was revealed that G.R.L. would be returning as a trio.

G.R.L. is a girl group that was formed by Robin Antin, best known for bringing together The Pussycat Dolls, but also created the Paradiso Girls, which Bennett was a member of as well.

Beginning in 2013, along with Bennett and Slayton, the original crew included Simone Battle, Emmalyn Estrada, and Paula van Oppen. Their first single “Vacation” was released alongside Britney Spears‘ “Ooh La La” to be included on the soundtrack for The Smurfs 2. Moving onto 2014, after achieving success with their feature on Pitbull’s “Wild Wild Love” in February, the group released their self-titled EP in July, spawning the successful single “Ugly Heart.”

In September 2014, Simone Battle was found dead in her home and the group took some time off. The following January in 2015, they released “Lighthouse,” a dedication to Battle. In June, it was announced that the group was disbanding. A year later, it was revealed that G.R.L. would be returning as a trio.

songs.title: Ugly Heart

description.plain:
“Ugly Heart” is  G.R.L.’s first radio single. It’s an upbeat pop tune about living a despicable boyfriend, despite his drop-dead looks, while taking the moral high ground in the process.

After the death of group member Simone Battle, the song moved to #11 on the UK Singles chart.

The music video came out July 29, 2014, showing the band dancing while they’re all being driven to the police station and getting processed. It received over 2.5 million views in less than a week, showing their potential to break out big.

songs.embed_content: Read “Ugly Heart” by G.R.L. on Genius

body.plain:
“Ugly Heart” is  G.R.L.’s first radio single. It’s an upbeat pop tune about living a despicable boyfriend, despite his drop-dead looks, while taking the moral high ground in the process.

After the death of group member Simone Battle, the song moved to #11 on the UK Singles chart.

The music video came out July 29, 2014, showing the band dancing while they’re all being driven to the police station and getting processed. It received over 2.5 million views in less than a week, showing their potential to break out big.

songs.lyrics:
24 ContributorsUgly Heart Lyrics[Verse 1: Simone Battle]
Maybe I'm just crazy, maybe I'm a fool
Maybe I don't know how to love, but maybe I do
Maybe you know more than me, but this much is true
This little heart and brain of mine say we're through witchu

[Pre-Chorus: Emmalyn Estrada]
And I wonder does it blow your mind?
That I'm leaving you far behind
I wonder does it stop your heart to know
You're not my sunshine, anymore
[Chorus: All]
Okay, you're pretty, your face is a work of art
Your smile could light up New York City after dark
Okay, you're Cover Boy pretty, stamped with a beauty mark
But it's such a pity, a boy so pretty
With an ugly heart

[Verse 2: Lauren Bennett]
Maybe you'll get married, and she will kiss your feet
While I give all my rides away, I won't lose no sleep
Maybe on your honeymoon you'll think of me
But if you don't, won't shed a tear, yeah I can guarantee

[Pre-Chorus: Natasha Slayton]
And I wonder does it blow your mind?
That I'm leaving you far behind
I wonder does it stop your heart to know
You're not my sunshine, anymore

[Chorus: All, Emmalyn]
Okay you're pretty, your face is a work of art
Your smile could light up New York City after dark
Okay you're Cover Boy pretty, stamped with a beauty mark
But it's such a pity, a boy so pretty (Ooh whoa, with an ugly heart)
With an ugly heart
You might also like[Bridge: Paula van Oppen]
Okay, you're pretty, your face is a work of art
Your smile could probably light up New York after dark
Okay, you're Cover Boy pretty, stamped with a beauty mark
But it's such a pity, a boy so pretty
With...

[Interlude: Natasha & Emmalyn & Simone]
An uh- an uh- an ugly heart
An uh- an uh- an ugly heart, so...

[Chorus: All, Emmalyn, Simone]
Okay you're pretty, your face is a work of art
Your smile could light up New York City after dark
Okay you're Cover Boy pretty, stamped with a beauty mark
But it's such a pity, a boy so pretty (Yeah, ooh whoa, with an ugly heart)
With an ugly heart
Okay you're pretty, your face is a work of art
Your smile could light up New York City after dark
Okay you're Cover Boy pretty, stamped with a beauty mark
But it's such a pity, a boy so pretty (So pretty, so pretty)
With an ugly heart25Embed

songs.title: Lighthouse

description.plain:
“Lighthouse” was the first song G.R.L. released since the death of band member Simone Battle. The single’s dedicated to her memory, and was released as apart of a partnership with mental health awareness organization Give an Hour.

It’s solemn tribute about providing support to a friend struggling with depression.

The music video has the remaining members singing among hanging lightbulbs, interspersed with footage of Simone.

songs.embed_content: Read “Lighthouse” by G.R.L. on Genius

Whenever, whatever, know I'm down for life
I'm your ride-or-die

songs.title: Vacation

description.plain: “Vacation” is the first single from the debuting girl group G.R.L., the next generation of the defunct Pussycat Dolls. It was released as a b-side of “Ooh La La” by Britney Spears.

songs.embed_content: Read “Vacation” by G.R.L. on Genius

album.full_title: The Smurfs 2 (Music from and Inspired By) by Various Artists
